text: what's up you guys taking another look at roaring Kitty's position from yesterday because I was in the middle of making a video he dropped his position and I shared a hypothesis that I don't think is accurate so I want to walk through what I'm seeing what it could mean and essentially why nobody can tell definitively what's going on here now a couple things you guys have been sharing so much of the background of roaring Kitty the way he behaves which is actually really useful for me and one of the things you guys said is hey he seems to exercises options a lot can you take another look and absolutely and as we take a look at this it absolutely could be the case but it's kind of a bit of a stretch in different ways depending on the scenario we're looking at but some of them are very plausible so let's quickly recap what his position was on the 10th of June which is long 5 million shares at 212 74 and he was long 10,000 of the 20 calls at 567 54 now couple things right out of the gate these are Big positions when you're trading 5 million shares 120,000 contracts of options you don't just enter a single order to get into that position it's something that you scale into over time and the reason being is you don't want to bid yourself up the other thing is in order to get

text: when you're trading 5 million shares 120,000 contracts of options you don't just enter a single order to get into that position it's something that you scale into over time and the reason being is you don't want to bid yourself up the other thing is in order to get essentially reasonable fills instead of just getting killed by submitting some sort of Market order to get a fill at that you again would scale into the position over some time so that tells us an important fact meaning he averaged into these positions we can also determine that and confirm it by the fact that there's more than two decimals on all these prices meaning the average price paid varied more big positions scaled into over time all kind of checks out the reason why that matters is because that tells us specifically on these calls that some of the premium he paid was above this price some of it was below this price how much higher and how many of those contracts we don't know and same thing to the downside so it makes it really really difficult to pinpoint what the premium he would have paid on the exercised options which is what we're using to try to determine if that's what he did so I'll show you what I mean by that now a really probable scenario here is that he could have exercised 4,010 of those 20 calls that accounts for the number variance here
